projectGridLines.title: 1) Conditioning-Based Monitoring - VAP  2) Reliability Improvement of SBP Drums
projectGridLines.description:
Description:  

This project aims to implement conditioning-based monitoring techniques for Value Added Products VAP plants. The objective is to enhance predictive maintenance capabilities, minimize downtime, and ensure the efficient operation of production equipment by accurately predicting potential failures.

This project focuses on improving the reliability and operational efficiency of SBP (Stable Bleaching Powder) drums. It involves analyzing current performance metrics, identifying common failure modes, and implementing engineering solutions to enhance the reliability and longevity of the drums

Skill sets: 

  • Basic understanding of mechanical systems and engineering principles
  • Knowledge of predictive maintenance techniques
  • Proficiency in data analysis and interpretation
  • Familiarity with vibratory analysis tools and software
  • Problem-solving and critical-thinking skills

Traits expectation: 

  • Attention to detail
  • Strong analytical abilities
  • Proactive and self-motivated
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a team
  • Good communication skills

Expected learning: 

  • Practical application of conditioning-based monitoring techniques
  • Hands-on experience with vibratory analysis and maintenance tools
  • Enhanced understanding of reliability engineering principles
  • Improved problem-solving and analytical skills
  • Experience in working on real-world engineering projects

Specific courses required for project execution:  

  • Mechanical Vibrations
  • Maintenance Engineering
  • Reliability Engineering
  • Data Analysis for Engineers
  • Predictive Maintenance Techniques

projectGridLines.title: Study of Transmission loss from 132 KV to 415 KV
projectGridLines.description:
Description: 

  1. This project involves a comprehensive study of transmission losses occurring when stepping down voltage from 132 KV to 415 KV. The objective is to identify the causes of transmission losses, analyze the current system's efficiency, and propose solutions to minimize these losses. The study will encompass both theoretical analysis and practical investigations, including data collection, field measurements, and simulations.

Skill sets:

  • Strong foundation in mechanical and electrical engineering principles
  • Knowledge of power transmission systems and electrical grid infrastructure
  • Proficiency in data collection, analysis, and interpretation
  • Familiarity with efficiency improvement techniques and mechanical system optimization
  • Competence in using simulation software and analytical tools

Traits expectation: 

  • Attention to detail and precision in data analysis
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Proactive and self-motivated approach to project tasks
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team
  • Effective communication and reporting skills

Expected learning:

  • In-depth understanding of power transmission systems and associated losses
  • Hands-on experience in identifying and mitigating transmission losses in electrical systems
  • Practical knowledge of mechanical efficiency improvement techniques in industrial settings
  • Enhanced problem-solving and analytical skills through real-world application
  • Experience in project management and execution within a professional engineering environment

Specific courses required for project execution: 

  • Power Systems and Transmission
  • Electrical Machines and Transformers
  • Maintenance Engineering
  • Mechanical Systems Design and Analysis
  • Data Analysis for Engineers
  • Energy Efficiency in Industrial Processes

projectGridLines.title: Efficiency Improvement of Phase 1 to 3 CCU - Mechanical
projectGridLines.description:
Description: 

This project aims to enhance the efficiency of the first three phases of the Chlorine Compression Unit (CCU). It involves analyzing current operational performance, identifying inefficiencies, and implementing mechanical improvements to optimize the process. The project will include a detailed review of mechanical components, process flow, and system integration to achieve improved operational efficiency and reliability.

Skill sets:

  • Strong foundation in mechanical and electrical engineering principles
  • Knowledge of power transmission systems and electrical grid infrastructure
  • Proficiency in data collection, analysis, and interpretation
  • Familiarity with efficiency improvement techniques and mechanical system optimization
  • Competence in using simulation software and analytical tools

Traits expectation: 

  • Attention to detail and precision in data analysis
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Proactive and self-motivated approach to project tasks
  • Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team
  • Effective communication and reporting skills

Expected learning:

  • In-depth understanding of power transmission systems and associated losses
  • Hands-on experience in identifying and mitigating transmission losses in electrical systems
  • Practical knowledge of mechanical efficiency improvement techniques in industrial settings
  • Enhanced problem-solving and analytical skills through real-world application
  • Experience in project management and execution within a professional engineering environment

Specific courses required for project execution: 

  • Power Systems and Transmission
  • Electrical Machines and Transformers
  • Maintenance Engineering
  • Mechanical Systems Design and Analysis
  • Data Analysis for Engineers

Energy Efficiency in Industrial Processes
